evidence_items.text: A tug driving instructor (tug instructor) and trainee tug driver (trainee driver) were seated beside each other in the tug. The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so. The headset operator continued walking on the right side of the tug, abeam its cabin. The wingman was on the left just ahead of the tug.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.
The tug instructor pulled the aircraft forward off the fence then stopped the tug.

roots_spec.exclusion_clause: Not explained by any other root

slot_statements.availability: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew was present and observable in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the hist_pair_engine_t1_early event on 12-25.
slot_statements.defeater_resistance: There is no evidence contradicting the presence of communication/coordination breakdown among crew in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the hist_pair_engine_t1_early event, indicating strong defeater resistance.
slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew aligns with the key features observed in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the hist_pair_engine_t1_early event, including timing, context, and crew interactions.

slot_statements.availability: The procedural deviation in pushback execution is observed and documented in the Boeing 737-8AS with registration 9H-QAA during the hist_pair_engine_t1_early event on 12-25.
slot_statements.defeater_resistance: The identified procedural deviation in pushback execution withstands scrutiny against potential alternative explanations or confounding factors within the context of the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA hist_pair_engine_t1_early event.
slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: The procedural deviation aligns with key features identified in pushback operations, including timing, crew actions, and environmental conditions specific to the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the hist_pair_engine_t1_early event.

node.statement: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew was present and observable in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the hist_pair_engine_t1_early event on 12-25.

assumptions: Assuming that the continued movement beyond the TRP despite communication attempts indicates a coordination breakdown among crew.
defeaters: If evidence showed clear, effective communication preventing the incident or that the event was caused solely by procedural deviation or environmental factors without coordination failure.

quotes.exact_quote: The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.
The tug instructor pulled the aircraft forward off the fence then stopped the tug.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Evidence H1-H3 shows communication and coordination attempts among crew and tug operators, while H4-H5 describe the aircraft moving beyond the stop point and hitting a barrier, indicating a breakdown in coordination and communication consistent with the claim.
outcome.uncertainty_source: Ambiguity in whether the event was primarily due to communication breakdown or procedural deviation; limited direct statements of communication failure.

node.statement: The procedural deviation in pushback execution is observed and documented in the Boeing 737-8AS with registration 9H-QAA during the hist_pair_engine_t1_early event on 12-25.

assumptions: The absence of evidence for communication breakdown or environmental/mechanical causes implies procedural deviation is the primary cause.
The documented actions and sequence of events accurately reflect the incident.
defeaters: If evidence showed a communication failure between crew members or headset operator that caused the deviation, it would favor communication breakdown instead.
If environmental or mechanical factors were documented as causes, the procedural deviation claim would be weakened.

quotes.exact_quote: The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Evidence H4 directly documents the procedural deviation in pushback execution with the aircraft moving beyond the designated release point and hitting a barrier, while H1-H3 and H5 provide context of crew actions and communication, supporting the claim and favoring procedural deviation over communication breakdown.
outcome.uncertainty_source: No direct evidence of communication failure or environmental/mechanical issues is present, so uncertainty arises from lack of contradictory evidence.
